steps.title: Set up the hyperbola equation
steps.content: The hyperbola has foci F(c, 0) and F'(-c, 0) with major axis length 6, so 2a = 6, meaning a = 3. The hyperbola equation is x²/9 - y²/b² = 1 where b² = c² - 9. For a valid hyperbola, we need c > a = 3.

steps.title: Analyze the hyperbola definition property
steps.content: For any point on the hyperbola: |PF'| - |PF| = ±2a = ±6. Since P is in the first quadrant (closer to F), we have |PF'| - |PF| = 6, meaning |PF'| > |PF|.

steps.title: Determine isosceles triangle configurations
steps.content:
For triangle PF'F to be isosceles with P in first quadrant:
- Case |PF'| = |PF|: Impossible since |PF'| - |PF| = 6.
- Case |PF'| = |FF'| = 2c: Then |PF| = 2c - 6 (requires c > 3).
- Case |PF| = |FF'| = 2c: Then |PF'| = 2c + 6.

steps.title: Analyze Q on line PF' and hyperbola
steps.content:
Q is on line PF' and also on the hyperbola (Q ≠ P). For Q on the hyperbola: |QF| - |QF'| = ±6.

If Q is between P and F' on line PF', then |PQ| = |PF'| - |QF'|.

Perimeter of triangle PQF = |PQ| + |QF| + |PF|.

steps.title: Case 1: |PF'| = 2c, |PF| = 2c - 6
steps.content:
Here P is on the right branch with |PF'| = 2c and |PF| = 2c - 6.

For Q between P and F': |PQ| = |PF'| - |QF'| = 2c - |QF'|.

Since Q is also on the hyperbola (right branch, closer to F): |QF'| - |QF| = 6, so |QF| = |QF'| - 6.

Perimeter = |PQ| + |QF| + |PF| = (2c - |QF'|) + (|QF'| - 6) + (2c - 6) = 4c - 12.

Setting 4c - 12 = 28: c = 10.

steps.title: Re-examine Case 1 with Q on different branch
steps.content:
If Q is on the left branch of hyperbola (closer to F'): |QF| - |QF'| = 6.

With Q between P and F': Perimeter = (2c - |QF'|) + (|QF'| + 6) + (2c - 6) = 4c.

Setting 4c = 28: c = 7.

Verify: c = 7 > 3, valid. b² = 49 - 9 = 40 > 0, valid.

steps.title: Case 2: |PF| = 2c, |PF'| = 2c + 6
steps.content:
Here P is on the right branch with |PF| = 2c and |PF'| = 2c + 6.

For Q between P and F': |PQ| = |PF'| - |QF'| = 2c + 6 - |QF'|.

If Q is on left branch: |QF| - |QF'| = 6, so |QF| = |QF'| + 6.

Perimeter = (2c + 6 - |QF'|) + (|QF'| + 6) + 2c = 4c + 12.

Setting 4c + 12 = 28: c = 4.

Verify: c = 4 > 3, valid. b² = 16 - 9 = 7 > 0, valid.

steps.title: Check if configurations are geometrically valid
steps.content:
For c = 7: |PF'| = 14, |PF| = 8, P on hyperbola in first quadrant. Triangle PF'F has |PF'| = |FF'| = 14, isosceles. Q exists on line PF' on the hyperbola.

For c = 4: |PF| = 8, |PF'| = 14, P on hyperbola in first quadrant. Triangle PF'F has |PF| = |FF'| = 8, isosceles. Q exists on line PF' on the hyperbola.

Both configurations are geometrically valid.

steps.title: Calculate the sum of all valid c values
steps.content:
The valid values of c are 4 and 7.

Sum = 4 + 7 = 11.
